Reviews.Title: “A little oasis”
Reviews.Author: Gianna1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Venice numerous times before, but no other hotel met our needs and expectations as well as Locanda Fiorita. We came by train and it was very easy to jump right on the #1 water bus to the Sant'Angelo stop. The directions they sent us were very clear and it was an easy 5 minute walk to the hotel. It is located in a lovely little square that makes it feel like an open oasis in the midst of tiny, twisting lanes. We stayed tree nights, and the variety of staff who helped us, went out of their way to be gracious and accomodating. Our room was small but very clean and comfortable. We especially enjoyed the breakfasts out on the terrace: coissants, rolls, cheeses, spreads, jams, yogurt and pots of hot coffee and hot milk. We enjoy walking, and really liked the easy walks to the San Marcos square area and to the Riallto Bridge area. I think this is an important point, as it is easy to get turned around or lost while walking in Venice, esp. for the uninitiated. But, we never had this problem as these routes are easy to see on a map and to negotiate from this little hotel, and that is a real plus!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money and excellent breakfast. Too bad for a couple of flaws.”
Reviews.Author: LR71
Reviews.Content: If I had to mention just one thing about the Locanda Fiorita, it would be its value for money. We stayed there a couple of nights around Christmas, paying just â‚¬51 per night for a double room (one of the small ones, called "Classic"). I guess it might cost more in other periods of the year, for instance during the Carnival, but to us it was a bargain, considering that the place is not bad at all. First of all, it is decent and clean. Secondly, the location is quiet and convenient, a 10-minute walk from Piazza San Marco and 3 minutes from the nearest "vaporetto" stop. (Too bad it is quite far from Santa Lucia railway station, but you can't be close to both Piazza San Marco and the railway station.) Besides, you will enjoy an excellent and abundant breakfast, with a wide variety of both sweet and savoury choices. Some days (both days, in our case) it is served in one of the two B&B's â€“ the Bloom and the Settimo Cielo â€“ run by the same owners and located in a nearby building. If you happen to have your breakfast there, take the opportunity to go up on the building's roof terrace overlooking the large Campo Santo Stefano and enjoy the scenic view. Despite the overall good impression, we found a couple of minor flaws too. A bad sewer smell came from the bathroom, though the bathroom was actually perfectly clean (besides being quite comfortable, by the way), but I guess Venice's canals are to blame for that more than the hotel. Keeping the bathroom door shut helped. We also temporarily moved a perfume diffuser from the corridor into our bathroom. After a while, we forgot the smell. Our second annoyance was the temperature in the room, definitely too high. The radiator was apparently oversized for our small room, which ended up being torrid although it was December and although we kept turning the radiator down. Finally, two other good points worth mentioning are the reservation process and the reception hours. Booking a room through the website is easy and straightforward. When you make your reservation, consider that the so-called "Classic" double rooms are very small. If you don't mind sleeping in a tiny bedroom, you can be content with a "Classic" room and save some money. On the contrary, if space matters to you and you are willing to pay a little more, you'd better choose a "Comfort" room. As for the opening hours, you can specify the approximate time of your arrival on the online reservation form and then you can check in even late at night, as the reception is open all night long, which cannot always be taken for granted in a hotel of this category.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great value and location”
Reviews.Author: rah373
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay (May '08), and we are happy to report that the Fiorita continues to be a terrific value. Excellent service, decent breakfast, clean pleasant room (#10 with private little balcony), its on a quiet mini-campo a few minutes from the Accademia. Nearest vaporetto stop (less than 5 min) is San Angelo on Linea 1 with only two little bridges to bounce roller luggage up and over (Accademia Bridge is formidable for those bags). That stop has the added advantage of being an Alilaguna stop for the airport every hour. Can't wait to stay there again - hopefully in a couple years!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for me!”
Reviews.Author: Mserwin2
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this lovely, quaint, clean and very helpful and friendly hotel. I was traveling alone and the location was so great - away from the busy areas, but very close to everything. I'm sure I had the smallest room w/ the shower & toilet just across the hallway - but with a sink in my room. It was a great price and very sweetly decorated - and clean! The staff (Jana, Patrick & Antony ;) were just incredibly kind and helpful. The weather was glorious (in October?!) so eating out on the courtyard each morning was lovely - with good coffee and simple continental fare (roll, cheese, yogurt, jams.) If you're looking for fancy - this won't be right for you, but if you're a romantic on a budget in Venice - I recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff Helped Make a Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Megan E
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the hotel and while it was a fairly small room, the staff went to great lengths of service to accommodate us as our reservation ended up being larger than specified etc. Antoni was especially helpful with recommendations and was a very enjoyable attendant that made us feel right at home in the cozy hotel. The perfect cute italian breakfast was served to us each morning. The location was great because it was in the middle of the area and close to the major places such as the rialto and st. marks, yet it was in a quieter neighborhood. Would definitely stay here again if we ever get to go back!

Reviews.Title: “An afordable little hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: meg1952
Reviews.Content: This tiny hotel had everything I needed- a bed, heat, a hairdryer a little desk and chair, a cupboard all for a very affordable price. Everything was clean. Other than the wonderful location, the best thing about it were the excepationally warm and helpful staff.They always had time to give directions, supply maps, deliver messages from friends who called in, and give suggestions to help guests get the best they could from their time in Venice.I would go back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: leslie l
Reviews.Content: Once we got off the Vaparetta at the proper stop we headed toward the piazza. We found we had traveled too far and turned around. Pretty nice room which was called a triple. A queen sized bed and day bed. Plenty of room, but no refrigerator. The breakfast we had was very good. Good coffee,Juice, croissants, sweet rolls, just enough for your first meal of the day to tide you over. The piazza with many restaurants are just up the block, Actually, too convienient, but great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Neurosurgeon
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Great value. Excellent support staff. Extremely good value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, personal and great”
Reviews.Author: dcandmjbrooks
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place with 5 stars for get the Locanda Fiorta. If you are looking for a little place with character and a friendly face. This is your place. About 400 meters St Marco and 100 meters from the Grand Canal it is a great place to base your selves. This was our second visit and if we went to Venice again we would go back. We love the place.

Reviews.Title: “No 4 stars here!”
Reviews.Author: Thedris
Reviews.Content: We did a quick over night in Venice and stayed at the Locanda Fiorita upon a friends suggestion. Not exactly what we had in mind and not exactly what we read in many reviews. The main building is quite old and extremely tight. We had what they considered a large room and there was about 20" of floor space around the three sides of the bed that you could get around. The "micro" bathroom was like that in a small yacht. To use the comode, you sat against the shower door. Just too tight and we are not large people. The rooms were just not nice, sorry. Location. Hmmm, where to begin. Almost everything immediately around the hotel was empty (as in closed up). The hotel is really in a deserted section of Venice. It is around the corner from San Stefano square, but that is the only highlight. Breakfast is primarily coffee and croissant. Period. The staff was very polite and very helpful. They really want to make it good but it is hard to do. Perhaps, we had our expectations set too high. But this one, was not a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable B&B”
Reviews.Author: JennyG81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this adorable B&B for a week while in Venice on our honeymoon. The location is great and the rooms are nice. Everything is smaller in Europe than what we are use to in Canada but we loved how authentic this place was. We are both tall and we had to bend down pretty low to brush our teeth at the sink...definitely not built for anyone over 5'6"! But we loved it, it was a total culture shock which is what we wanted from this trip. Breakfasts were great and plentiful and the staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants. Overall great little place! We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great location and the staff make it delightful, would stay again..”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn_L81
Reviews.Content: Basic rooms, a bit small. Breakfast was average but better than nothing. Can not rate the staff highly enough in particular the English man that appeared to run the place, he really knows what customer service is. Would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - must come back in summer”
Reviews.Author: patsynemo
Reviews.Content: By Venice standards the rooms are a good size and the soundproofing is excellent - I slept well. Lovely friendly staff. Breakfast is served on a super terrace - but that's something I would need a warm day to appreciate. The location is fabulous - close to water taxi stand from the airport, walking distance to Accademia Bridge and the old centre. Lots of interesting small shops and nice restaurants close by. I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Could use Renovation, But Awesome Value; Location”
Reviews.Author: Donnico1
Reviews.Content: Venice is super expensive. Locanda Fiorita could use renovation to its rooms and bathrooms, but for the money and the location its hard to beat. While initially this hotel seemed daunting to find (Venice is like a labyrinth), we did not encounter a problem finding the hotel. Be advised you will need to carry bags up and over a small bridge, but this is par for the course in that city. The hotel is located in a tiny, picturesque piazza smack in the middle of the San Marco quarter of the city (by far the most touristy), but far enough away from the main tourist drags that one develops a feel of what "real" Venice must be like. Access to the water taxi is quick and the main tourist sights (i.e. Piazza San Marco, The Rialto) are only a 5-10 minute walk, so the location is ideal. The hotel from the outside is very cute and is one of the prettier hotels in the city. They have free wifi access although the signal was poor in our room. Upon arrival we were given room #1 which unfortunately was on the first floor right outside the main entrance area where breakfast is served. We were not comfortable leaving our shutters open most of the time due to the fact that other guests could peer into our room at breakfast or even when they were walking up stairs to enter the hotel. This was not a major problem, however, due to the fact that when one is in Venice, one does not spend much time in a hotel. Our room was clean and had a modern little TV, but it looked like it could use some restoration work. The wallpaper was peeling and the bathroom was tiny and old. Also, the smell of fried fish permeated our bathroom due to it's location- perched above one of Venice's most authentic restaurants (which was not entirely bad- authentic Venetian cuisine is right around the corner). Breakfast is adequate and the staff is professional. Best of all, there's a 10% discount if you pay the hotel bill in cash. In short, Locanda Fiorita is an excellent budget option for Venice. I would recommend it, as you will spend enough money on food (or just about anything else) in Venice. If you book and don't require a four star ripoff, you will not be disappointed- just ask not to be in room #1 unless you like fried fish.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudyPIllinois
Reviews.Content: I and 5 of my friends stayed in 3 rooms Sunday, October 3, 2010. It was very easy to find - a big plus for Venice - and quite comfortable. Our bedroom window overlooked the alley behind us, and the windows closed out all of the noise. Our room was clean, comfortable and quite nice - although as is all of Venice very old. The staff was most helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have found a better place for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: scalliet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for our honeymoon. They offered us the "honeymoon package" which included a welcome champagne bottle, a sunset gondola ride, a guided trip to the islands of Murano, Burano and Torcello, tickets to the Casino (which we didn't use, it wasn't our style) and most wonderful of all: a dinner for two at one of the best seafood specialities restaurant in Venice (the Riviera, on Dorsoduro), conveniently located 15 minute walk from the hotel. We weren't sure if the honeymoon package would turn out to be a waste of money, but it was AMAZING. That dinner alone was worth the money - we would have never splurged on such an expensive dinner if it hadn't been part of the package. We will remember that meal forever. We got the room with a separate entrance off the main courtyard (room 10); there is a little table with two chairs on the landing right next to the room and they served us breakfast there in private every morning. Every night we would come back and sit at that table with some wine and maybe pizza we bought elsewhere - it was quiet and private and oh-so-romantic. The room was decorated in old-fashioned Venetian style and it was much roomier than we had expected. The bed was comfortable. The breakfast was absolutely delicious (croissants, bread rolls, cheese, Nutella, jam, yogurt, etc...) - in fact every morning we had enough food to eat a full breakfast and pack up the rest of the rolls, cheese, etc for our lunch that day which saved us a lot of money. We felt very special the entire stay there. The staff was very friendly - one of them even helped us figure out our train situation for the next part of the honeymoon and gave us some excellent tips on what to do in Capri, down south. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the center but stay at a quiet, charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: AustinPiper
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. You can walk to any of the main attractions in 5 to 20 minutes. If you are trying to save some money and don't need the fancy hotels, this is a great place! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast on the patio was nice and quaint. We will definitely stay here again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkie58
Reviews.Content: Just back from Venice stayed at the Locanda Fiorita,great location and very friendly helpful staff,We had a nice breakfast on the patio outside,we also had a night in their bed and breakfast called Bloom which was wonderfully decorated and so peaceful and quiet our children were made very welcome by all the staff Watch out for the restaurants around there though,we had two great meals at Taverna San Trovaso just accross the bridge which was fine.Handy hint-The Orange line Alilaguna service runs from Marco Polo to San Angelo stop right near the hotel Also be aware tha restaurants in Venice close kind of early

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: zoberonn
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal. Near to all the major sightseeings and very close to a lovely square. The stuff is very helpful and they speak english fluently and the breakfast is served in the yard in the summer months. The building though, as most of the buildings in Venice, is old and the smell of moisture is intense. The rooms are small and the walls are made from paper. But according to the prices in the city, I think that is a good choice if you are not too spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ine2201
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fiorita for three nights. We were in the guesthouse around the corner from the main hotel. The staff was very helpful, and provided good recemmendations for dinner. Location is good with easy access to the water busses, and the Accademia. Easy walk to Piazza San Marco, but far enough away so as not have the crowds. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rah373
Reviews.Content: Traveling with friends, we loved this place for its quiet patio literally right around a corner from bustling San Stefano campo. It feels like you have your own private piece of Venice. Staff was very pleasant and helpful, particularly with an airline headache I had. (American Express was plain rude!) Great location near San Samuele and Accademia stops. Twice we picnicked there at the alfresco breakfast tables, buying panini and fruit from the bar at the corner, wine from the enoteca immediately behind the hotel. We discovered a special feature of that wineshop intended for locals - buying "bulk" wine in big 1.5 liter plastic water bottles for 4 euros! They said it was "young", but not bad at all! We have stayed in several excellent places in Venice over the years, but this was by far the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located with easy access to St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: tsully_pg2
Reviews.Content: Our experience was in line with other reviews we found during our research. This hotel is in a great location and a good choice for budget-concious travelers. We stayed in room #1, just around the corner from the front desk. The room was quiet and we had a private bath. If you want a room with a private bath, you have to request it in your reservation request. The bathroom is a bit small and narrow. The shower stall was tiny, but it does have a window. Note: there are no wash cloths in most of the hotels in Italy, just hand and bath towels. If you are accustomed to using a wash cloth...we suggest you take your own. There is a good selection of breakfast foods to choose from and it's served outside in the courtyard in front of the hotel. Be warned...we ate outside on cool October mornings. We dressed appropriately (i.e. coats and scarves). Daniela, the reservation and customer care manager, was wonderful and she has a very cute and sweet dog named Pluto who occasionally hangs out in the lobby greeting guests as they return from a day of sightseeing. The front desk clerks were very helpful with directions and maps. Locanda Fiorita is a nice hotel and is easy to get to from the San Angelo water taxi stop.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Taste of Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Radalicious
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted to splurge on a hotel on our Euro-excursion so we decided that Venice would be the place that would be the most appropriate city do do that in. We chose this hotel because it looked so beautiful in the photos and it boasted luxurious decor. It also said on the website that it was conveniently located and easy to find. My friend and I did not believe how disappointed we were, nothing met our expectations. It was hard to find, it had shared bathrooms, small rooms, unhelpful service. That's ok for hostels, etc. but we were expecting to get our money's worth. We were so upset that we found another hotel. This basically saved Venice for us, because Hotel Fiorita was so terrible and such a big letdown and put us in such a bad mood.

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations...disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Eternoviaggiatore
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice many times, so I know well the map of the city and I've chosen this hotel because of its location, that is perfect. Before booking our stay, I've read many reviews on Tripadvisor and all around the net. Some of them sounded enthusiastic, some of them really disappointing, so, In order to make our stay the best as possible and to avoid any kind of problem, I booked a "Comfort room", paying for it 50 euros more than a standard room. Well, the hotel is very small although very cosy and charming, and everything is made to give you the feeling to sleep in an old ancient romantic venetian room. But what was really disappointing was the bathroom: so small that neither my husband (he is 1.92 tall) nor me (I am not tall at all) could enter it! Toilet was too close to the shower to sit on it and the sink was so small that it was really hard even to brush your teeth. Even though on the web site there was written "all services included in the bathroom", bidet was missing! When I complained about this, they told me that I should have requested for it. But when I booked a "Comfort room", it was supposed to be a "COMFORT" room, so I thought it was one of the best room I could have chosen (and, of course, it is well known that italians like us prefer to have the bidet). Moreover, the first day we returned to the room at 1.30 pm and the room has not been cleaned up yet, so as we needed to stay in till late, the room has been left dirty and messy till the next day. Anyway, breakfast was ok, staff very kind and helpful and location perfect, but the hotel is absolutely TOO EXPENSIVE compared to the accomodation offered. I don't think I won't come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: countydownrose
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our recent stay at the Locanda Fiorita.Typically Venetian in style, but quaint and quirky too.What a convenient location near all the main attractions and water bus stops.Very friendly helpful staff,infact couldnt fault this lovely place.Great value for money in an extremely expensive city.Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to people

Reviews.Title: “The locks don't work, but the staff is nice...”
Reviews.Author: Oyp
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that the staff was very friendly, which was probably their way of keeping people from yelling at them... We booked another hotel originally, but they were overbooked and referred us to the Locanda Fiorita. We also wanted an en-suite bathroom, but Locanda Fiorita was sold out of those and we were tired of getting denied, so we took a room with a "private bathroom" down the hall. To get from our room (#6) to the private bathroom, we had to walk past every other room on that floor AND the sliding door that opens to the lobby. Not very private. I guess we could have handled the lack of privacy while coming back from the shower, but it was made intolerable by the fact that the locks (which appeared to be about 50 years old) on our room and bathroom required about 10-20 seconds of jiggling before one could lock or unlock the darn door! The bathroom did have a thumb-turn lock on the inside, but our room didn't, so we had to use the key to lock our hotel room from the inside, which was not possible if one's spouse was using the key to go to the bathroom. We also made use of the hotel's wireless internet using our laptop. The front desk had a nifty security box that printed a unique username and password for guests to log on to their encrypted connection. The problem was that our username and password were only good for one hour at a time, so if we were on the internet for longer than an hour, we would get thrown off the wireless connection and had to walk to the front desk (after jiggling the key in our lock) in order to ask politely for a new username and password. I also had a lot of trouble uploading photos to Flickr over their wireless connection, despite having had no trouble at the hotel in Florence. I don't know if this was due to a slow connection or maybe somekind of firewall issue. Breakfast was good. Staff was nice. Our "double" bed was two twins pushed together. Small room, worn around the edges. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, charming room, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Italian-Adventure07
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Locanda Fiorita in Venice. Perfect location and our room was incredibly charming (we had number 10 with the balcony). Breakfast was served to us on our balcony. Some of the staff was a little bit unfriendly and at times rude, but other staff was helpful and nice. We got some bad advice regarding how to get to the airport from one guy (one of the owners we think) but thankfully the night staff person gave us an easier and much cheaper route! So the lesson there was to ask more than one person! We would highly recommend the hotel as it was clean, cute and in a great location in beautiful Venice! (Easy to get to by Vaporetto from the main train station. Just ask the hotel people for directions before you go).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JennyH78
Reviews.Content: We stayed only two nights. Venice is so touristy that I assume all hotel rooms are fairly small. This was no exception. It was a tiny room with a tiny bathroom but it worked. We had A/C and a TV and a bed. I guess that's all we needed. The reception desk was very nice and accomodating. It was a pleasant experience but nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little inn”
Reviews.Author: akikodancer
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Venice was really cute. Venice is so incredibly expensive that anything under about $200/night is a great deal, so getting a room for $170 in the height of tourist season in July was pretty good. It is a cute little hotel a short walk from the water ferry stop in a quiet little square, not far from anything. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only slightly strange thing was the door to our room was behind the front desk, so getting in and out was a little weird, but I didn't mind at all. The room was decorated in traditional Venetian decor, with a large, comfortable bed. The air conditioning did not work very well though, so even when it was on full it only cooled off to about 77degrees F - a little warm for sleeping. The bathroom was fine, it could use a remodel but nothing was wrong and everything worked fine. Breakfast was okay, just some bread and coffee (great cappucino though), but be warned they end exactly at 10am. All in all, I think it was a great bargain hotel in Venice. I would stay there again if trying to save money, although I might consider spending a bit more to stay at a nicer hotel on the water if I can afford to in the future. Venice is amazing - definitely a place that must be visited!!! Although in the future I would avoid the summer because it is pretty hot and so busy. We couldn't even see over the Rialto bridge because there were so many people and the lines were too long to go into St. Mark's Basilica or the Doge's palace. Next time I'll go in the fall or winter.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Locanda Fiorita
HotelInfo.Address: Campiello Novo - San Marco, 3457, 30124 Venice, Italy
